metadata.title: CVE-2014-7208 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
GParted before 0.15.0 allows local users to execute arbitrary commands withroot privileges via shell metacharacters in a crafted filesystem label.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7208` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gparted - 0.18.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gparted package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.18.0-1').
